intro: Adenandra ciliata, commonly known as the silky adenandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Adenandra ciliata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained, acidic soils.
